data.title: Location of Windows COA sticker on Dell PowerEdge R710
data.meta_description: I'm asking somebody at a remote location to find the Windows Product key / Certificate of Authenticity for a Dell PowerEdge R710 that shipped with Windows Server 2008.  Where should I ask them to l...
data.text:
It's on top of the server at the front on the left hand side.

If your server is mounted in a rack with something else above it, it will probably need to be slid out on the rails by 4-5 inches, in order to view the label.

Dell R710's have a pull out tab on the front of the server that will show the servers serial number and other dell info. If this is an OEM copy of windows it might be on the tab. That said I have never seen a 710 that has the windows key sticker on it.

If it's a rack server it's most commonly on the top cover, or the back. If it's a tower it's usually on the back or the side. In any case it should be pretty easy to find unless the server is burried in the DC.
